definition: lit. can pass through (an opening)/fig. can get by (in life)/tolerably well/not too bad/How are you getting by?/How's life?
surname Guo
to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-
(experienced action marker)
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to

to go/to go to (a place)/(of a time etc) last/just passed/to send/to remove/to get rid of/to reduce/to be apart from in space or time/to die (euphemism)/to play (a part)/(when used either before or after a verb) to go in order to do sth/(after a verb of motion indicates movement away from the speaker)/(used after certain verbs to indicate detachment or separation)

sentences.english: I'm able to get by, but it could be better.
sentences.chinese: 我的糊口还过得去，不过还可以更好。

sentences.english: Don't bother to move I think I can just brush past.
sentences.chinese: 用不着让开，我想我刚好能过得去。

sentences.english: I'd say her work is of a reasonable standard.
sentences.chinese: 我认为她的工作水平还过得去。

sentences.english: Well, maybe you can go without it for awhile, until you do find a used version.
sentences.chinese: 也许，在找到一个二手的之前，一时没有它也过得去。

sentences.english: B: I'm able to get by, but it could be better.
sentences.chinese: 我的生活还过得去，不过还可以更好。

sentences.english: Does the new manager pass muster?
His pronunciation, if not good, is at least tolerable.
sentences.chinese: 他的发音如果说不算好，至少也还过得去。

sentences.english: Your work will get by,but try to improve it.
sentences.chinese: 你的作业还过得去，但要努力改进。

definition: acceptable/passable/justifiable/(of a course of action) to make sense
careless/casual/vague/not so bad/so-so/tolerable/fair
to bring together/to make do in a bad situation/to just get by/to improvise/passable/not too bad
to achieve with difficulty/only just up to the task/barely adequate
to fall short of the best but be better than the worst/can pass muster
pinyin: bi3 shang4 bu4 zu2 bi3 xia4 you3 yu2

definition: not bad/OK
to not lack
not up to much/very indifferent/nothing great about it/nothing good to be said about it
(coll.) not bad/good/fine
(dialect) not that great/not up to much/nothing special
very good
to do with difficulty/to force sb to do sth/reluctant/barely enough
not presentable/shoddy and too embarrassing to show
to be unable to say or tell/to not be worth mentioning
at the minimum/at the very least
not much different/similar/ordinary/nearly
ugly/shameful/to ridicule
